Dans ce sens, on peut comprendre pourquoi jambe et suffire s’écrivent à l’aide du même kanji.  --  En composant placé à gauche, cet élément sera modifié en  . Sa signification demeure jambe, mais pour éviter toute confusion avec les diverses jambes dont nous disposons déjà, nous lui attribuerons le sens de jambe de bois.

column11: Person . . . leg.  -    -  Mr T, ever the optimist, is trying to stimulate Capt Ahab´s wooden leg by rubbing it down. Capt Ahab normally wouldn´t let anyone do that, but he appreciates Mr T´s stimulating conversation.  -  You stimulate a person by giving him a kick.
column12: Tintin...jambe. Il s’agit de faire avancer les choses, bon gré, mal gré.  --

column11: Wooden leg . . . gigantic.  -    -  You can step a long-distance if you have a leg that´s gigantic!  -  You can step a long-distance if you have gigantic wooden legs (stilts).
column12: Jambe de bois...géant. Pensez aux « bottes de sept lieues » pour parcourir cette distance, à prendre au sens général.  --

column11: Wooden leg . . . each.  -    -  When pirates try to hide, it´s always easy to find them. Their wooden legs leave distinctive prints, showing where each is hiding and the exact path he took.  -  I have a wooden leg for each type of path. One with a rubber stopper at the end for absorbing shocks on paved paths, and one with a wide foot to distribute weight better on mud paths.
column12: Jambe de bois...chaque. Si tous les chemins mènent à Rome, chacune des jambes de bois doit suivre le chemin, car elle ne peut s’égarer dans les fourrés broussailleux.  --

column11: Rain . . . path.  -    -  After the rain the path was covered with dew.  -  Dew forms on the path least weathered.
column12: De la pluie sur le chemin nous donne de la rosée. Associé à ce sens premier, on trouve dévoiler : lorsque la rosée tombe au petit matin, une nouvelle journée commence, et la nature nous dévoile de nouvelles surprises. Ce kanji est aussi le symbole de la Russie, par homophonie.  --

column11: Wooden leg . . . portent.  -    -  A girl with a wooden leg always wanted to play hopscotch with the other girls, but every time she tried to hop she´d lose her balance and injure another girl. That´s why the other girls make fun of her and see her presence as a portent to injury.  -  A turtle with a wooden leg needs to hop to get around.
column12: Jambe de bois...augures. Pour les augures, une jambe de bois ne présage pas d'un grand saut. Et pourtant si, nous dit le kanji.  --

column11: Wooden leg . . . feathers . . . turkey.  -    -  Well, there are weekdays weekday (#576) and there are laundry days laundry (#577), and on February 29th leap day, the manufacturer recommends servicing or replacing your peg leg because they tend to wear out every 4 years.  -  [Story for people following katsuo in making feathers+turkey a ´futon´ primitive] If you´re going to leap from a high place, better hope there´s a futon below -- otherwise you´re going to break your leg at the very least...
column12: Jambe de bois...dinde perdant ses plumes. Il y a dans ce kanji une sorte de vivacité, une capacité à aller de l'avant. Une dinde empêtrée avec une jambe de bois mais qui se démène au point de faire voler ses plumes peut fournir une image raisonnable.  --

column11: Wooden leg . . . parade float.  -    -  The pirate with the wooden leg chased after the parade float and was run over by the next one, leaving tread marks all over him and his leg.  -  Pirates must tread carefully when walking on parade floats, so as not to break through the weak plaster with their wooden legs.
column12: Jambe de bois...planchette. Si vous avez une jambe de bois, il s'agit d'avancer sans sortir des sentiers battus, en respectant l'ordre prévu des choses, comme lors d'une promenade dans un parc au Japon, où l'on doit suivre le sens de la visite indiqué sur de petites planchettes.  --

column6: step on, trample, tread on, walk
column11: The meaning of this character is virtually identical with that of the last frame. Be sure to come up with distinct connotations suggested by phrases in which each is commonly used. Wooden leg . . . water . . . sun.  -    -  This is better remembered as "step on" or trample. I picture a puddle of water with the sun reflected in it (to get the water above sun positioning), then you step on the puddle with your foot to trample the image.  -  So, we´ve walked on the moon, but it´s going to take a pirate with a wooden leg, with a huge supply of cooling water to land on the sun and take that "one small step for a man".
column12: Le sens est voisin de celui du cadre 1392 : jambe de bois...soulier. Pour fouler plus aisément, nous mettons un soulier autour de notre jambe de bois.  --

column6: bone; skeleton; frame, framework; Kangxi radical 188
column11: This kanji and primitive refers to the part of the body composed of the bones and their joints. The top part of the kanji, terminating in the element for crown, is a pictograph of a bone joint. I leave it to you to put the pieces together, so to speak.  -    -  Your body meat is attached to the bone joints of your skeleton.  -  The top box 口 is the skull and the brain 田 has shriveled to the size of marble (but following kanji convention it is depicted as a square) and rolled into the bottom right hand corner. With all the hair and flesh gone the crown has slipped down to the shoulders like a necklace. 月 represents the rest of the body of the skeleton. [Idea for position of crown thanks to n1williams].
column12: Ce kanji représente la partie du corps comprenant les os et les jointures. L’élément supérieur terminé en couronne est le pictogramme d’une de ces jointures : à vous donc de recoller les morceaux, pour ainsi dire.  --

column11: Water . . . skeleton.  -    -  Don´t give water to a skeleton. When he drinks it, it´ll sluice right through his bones, forcing you to put one of those "Caution - Slippery Floor" signs up on the resultant puddle.  -  Slippery surfaces are very dangerous for skeletons, since their bone feet slip easily... a few drops of water, and zweep! A large mess of bones to pick up and reassemble!
column12: Eau...os. Voici une flaque d'eau. Vous y marchez, vous glissez, vous faites une mauvaise chute, et vous vous cassez un os.  --

column11: Skeleton . . . possess . . . road.  -    -  A skeleton is shuffling along the shoulder of the road, so you pull up next to him and ask where he is going. He says he´s going to donate his marrow to the hospital because he got into some financial trouble and lost everything; his marrow is the only thing he still possesses.  -  A skeleton by the side of the road, holding a sign "Possess marrow, will travel". Yeah, it makes no sense but I don´t foget the kanji.
column12: Os...posséder...voie. La moelle, comme il est écrit ici, se trouve dans le « canal-voie » que possède l'os en son milieu.  --

column11: Altar . . . jawbone.  -    -  Continued from auspicious (#1088). Once a year, the people pray for a sign from the gods. But if the gods are feeling particularly mischievous, they´ll send down a jawbone to the altar. The people see this as a sign of calamity to come. The gods think of it as an amusing prank.  -  Calamity Jane went to the altar to confess her sins and the priest´s jawbone fell to the floor...　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　か　禍福　かふく (fortune and misfortune)...　Pure Group: 渦1292　過1293.
column12: Autel...mâchoire. La calamité est une sorte de colère des dieux sortant de leurs autels et dont la mâchoire se resserre sur nous.  --

column11: Water . . . jawbone.  -    -  Grampa´s flushing the toilet, when his denture (Jawbone) pops out and gets sucked down the whirlpool!  -  A whirlpool is water opening its jaws to swallow anything whole.
column12: Eau...mâchoire. L’histoire sera complète si vous imaginez votre navire dans un maelstrom, une mâchoire d'eau.  --

column11: Jawbone . . . road.  -    -  Jaws XII~! Jaws strikes the highway! Man, they´re really overdoing it now.  -  In ´American History X´ Edward Norton´s character overdoes it when he makes the dude that tried to steal his car lie face down with his jawbone open over the pavement of the roadway and then stamps on the back of his head. My teeth still tingle when I think of that!
column12: Route...mâchoire. Ce mot-clé veut rendre les deux sens du kanji : dépasser une limite, ou passer son temps, ici en mâchant un chewing-gum sur la route !  --  Chapitre trente-quatre Le haut et le bas  DES hauts et des des bas dans ces pages : un tertre, lieu élevé, sera suivie d'un trou, lieu moins élevé.

column11: This character is used for proper names, much as the English word "Heights" is. Its primitives: pinnacle . . . anti-.  -    -  If you´re scared of Heights, you don´t want to stay at The Pinnacle; you are anti- The Pinnacle. Primitive: The Pinnacle is a dream-like gated community at the top of a mount. This allows for innumerable stories for all the kanji with this primitive since you have a whole city to work with. Also prevents confusion with "mountain".  -  People are being displaced in 大阪 to make room for a new development, Osaka Heights, the pinnacle of modern Japanese housing. An angry mob of protestors are outside with Anti-Osaka Heights signs.
column12: Ce kanji est principalement utilisé dans les noms propres, où il porte le même sens que le kanji pente (cadre 797). Les éléments sont tertre...anti.  --

column6: prefix for people's names; used in transliteration
column11: This kanji, an abbreviation for Africa, is now used chiefly for its sound, "a," not unlike the kanji for Italy and the sound "i" that we met earlier (Frame 1245). Its composite elements are: pinnacles . . . can.  -    -  Can you see Africa from The Pinnacle? I can! I can!  -  A kinda pictogram: ´BoT´, the first 3 letters in ´Botswana´ an African country.
column12: Tertre...possible. Ce kanji est aujourd’hui surtout employé dans son second sens : Afrique. Ce caractère apparaît aussi dans l'écriture du mont Aso, 阿蘇[あそ], dont les tertres du possible flattent les amateurs de mythes.  --

column11: Pinnacle . . . ritual.  -    -  Many rituals are practiced every day (blessing before meals, evening prayer, etc.) Only the peak rituals (wedding, Bar Mitzvah, etc.) qualify to be called an occasion.  -  On occasian, rituals are held at the very tip of The Pinnacle.
column12: Tertre...rituel. Le rituel annuel est l'occasion de gravir le chemin menant au tertre.  --

column11: Pinnacle . . . possess . . . road.  -    -  [Image: Follow the ´Yellow-Brick Road´ to success] The pinnacle signifies your personal goal and destination. What you´re seeking to possess lies at the end of the yellow-brick road. You must follow the road to get what you want.  -  I fled to The Pinnacle for safety, but the demon followed me right up the road!
column12: Pour parvenir au tertre, nous empruntons la route qu'il possède, et nous nous contentons de suivre. Revoyez 1398 au besoin pour clarifier le sens de l'élément de droite.  --

column11: Pinnacle . . . badge.  -    -  The officer at the gate to The Pinnacle with a giant badge sewn to his chest hinders all visitors. But not the handicapped. They´re hindered enough already. They´re given a badge and can pass right into The Pinnacle.  -  The pinnacle of racism was that of the Nazis. They made the Jews wear a badge on their clothes to identify them. They hindered their every movement. Moreover the peace-loving Dutch all wore the badges so that the Jews would be unidentifiable. Effectively hindering the Nazi plot.
column12: Tertre...badge. Une question qui n'est pas encore résolue veut que quiconque n'a pas le « badge » de masculinité est empêché d'accéder au tertre qu'est l'espace circulaire où les joueurs de sumô s'affrontent.  --

column11: Pinnacle . . . muzzle.  -    -  In case of emergency, The Pinnacle has auxiliary guard dogs, but they keep them muzzeled until they´re needed.  -  When you climb the pinnacle you´ll need to take a muzzle of auxiliary oxygen.
column12: Tertre...muselière. Dans les plus hautes fonctions du protocole, on reste discret, on garde la muselière même en haut du tertre.  --

column6: the active, male principle in Chinese philosophy (yang); light; sun
column10: Éclat solaire, principe naturel masculin (Yang), soleil, adret
column11: Different from the primitive for sun (which figures in the character) and the kanji for ray (Frame 125), the key word sunshine is meant to convey the meaning of the masculine principle in nature, or "Yang." (The dark is viewed mythically as the feminine principle; see frame 1718.) From there it comes to mean sun also. The elements are: pinnacle . . . piggy bank.  -    -  A kid is perched on a pinnacle with his piggy bank. He uses the coins to catch the sunshine, and redirect it into people´s eyes, far below.  -  The Pinnacle is environmentally friendly. They collect solar power through sunshine on their piggybank shaped solar arrays.
column12: Ce kanji porte la signification du principe naturel masculin (Yang), le principe féminin (1737) étant défini par l'ombre. Par association, il en vient à signifier soleil, également. Les composants sont tertre...lumière solaire matinale. Il montre la partie de la montagne à proximité du tertre la plus exposée au soleil, l'adret.  --

column11: Pinnacle . . . east.  -    -  Every morning at The Pinnacle, the residents line upon the East side for morning stretches and leisure.  -  Hikers line up to get to the top of that great pinnacle of the East... Mount Fuji. Seriously, they really do! ...probably the only mountain in the world with a queue at the top.
column12: Tertre...Est (Japon). Songez qu'au Japon, à l'Est, on pense toujours à bien présenter les choses, à placer en évidence sur un tertre des détails ordinaires, afin de mieux informer l'interlocuteur et le convaincre. Ce kanji en dit peut-être plus que les écrits des spécialistes décortiquant les secrets du Soleil Levant.  --

column11: Pinnacle . . . compass.  -    -  A giant compass is The Pinnacle´s self-defense system. It points in the direction of any invaders so the city is prepared well ahead to ward off the intruders.  -  To ward off enemies, the ancient Greece kept watch from the Acropolis, where they had a clear view in all directions.
column12: Une boussole est placée sur le tertre, pour assurer la protection contre un danger imminent.  --

column6: adhere to, append; rely on near to
column11: Pinnacle . . . adhere.  -    -  A sign was AFFIXED on the PINNACLE of the Acropolis so that tourists would ADHERE to the rules.  -  The Pinnacle is firmly affixed to the top of the mount with bubble gum. (adhere (#1000)).
column12: Tertre...adhérer. Le sens est pratiquement identique à celui d'adhérer.  --

column11: This key word, the abbreviation for Institution, represents the use of that word as a suffix affixed to certain buildings and organizations. Its primitive elements: pinnacle . . . perfect.  -    -  The Institution of The Pinnacle is perfect in every way. It is the new House of God, his chosen city.  -  To reach the pinnacle of kanji perfect you need to attend the Heisig Inst.
column12: Abréviation d'institution, ce mot-clé est choisi pour symboliser l'utilisation faite de ce kanji comme suffixe désignant certains immeubles ou organisations. Les éléments sont tertre...parfait. Il s'avère que souvent ces institutions sont installées dans des constructions architecturalement parfaites, en tous cas à l'époque de leur construction, juchées au sommet d'une colline, un tertre, afin qu'on en perçoive d'emblée la noblesse.  --

column6: column, row or file of troops
column11: Pinnacle . . . car.  -    -  Paparazzi make camp outside of The Pinnacle in their cars, waiting for the celebs to come out.  -  Note: This kanji is most often used in a military context. Story: Here we see an encampment of military vehicles laying siege to The Pinnacle. With other countries being envious of the perfect life they lead there that makes sense. Fortunately, the pinnacle knows how to ward off (#1302) enemies.
column12: La présence d'une voiture sur le tertre est anormale : nous sommes en temps de guerre, et un campement militaire s'y est installé.  --

column11: Pinnacle . . . animal horns . . . sow.  -    -  Every regiment of The Pinnacle´s army is lead by a Miss Piggy with a viking helmet on.  -  Every regiment of The Pinnacle´s army has an animal name. This regiment is called "Horned Pig Regiment". They´re wearing Wiking helms and are usually cowered in mud.
column12: Tertre...cochons au travail (revoyez le 592).   --

column6: fall down, drop, sink, go to ruin
column11: Regiment . . . ground.  -    -  One of the members of our air force regiment has been shot down; he managed to safely eject, but his plane crashed into the ground.  -  The regiment led by horny Miss Piggy wearing a viking helmet accidently falls off The Pinnacle and crashes into the ground below. // old story with wrong meaning of regiment: Kermit is so frustrated with horny Miss Piggy´s regimented sex schedule, he throws her off The Pinnacle and she crashes into the ground.
column12: Qu’un gros porteur s’écrase sur le sol, et l’équivalent d'un véritable régiment de vies humaines est perdu.  --

column11: Pinnacle . . . walking legs . . . sunglasses with a lens popped out. Distinguish from fall (Frame 320) and crash, which we considered in the previous frame.  -    -  Sunglasses-missing-one-lens is obviously the monocle. The proper, high-class way to descend The Pinnacle is wearing a monocle with your walking legs splayed to a full gentlemanly stride.  -  After a cool, hip businessman angered the executives at The Pinnacle, they beat him up, popping out a lens from his sunglasses, and tossed out the window, head first, walking legs second. One executive later commented, "It was like he was descending into Hell from Heaven!".
column12: Tertre...jambes qui marchent...l'un des deux pieds écartés. Il s'agit ici de descendre du tertre ou du train mais ici avec un seul pied, donc nous descendons à cloche-pied. Le kanji concerne aussi les précipitations, ce qui descend du ciel.  --

column11: The story of this character refers to floors in a building. The elements: pinnacle . . . all.  -    -  All buildings of The Pinnacle are multi-storey. They don´t have much room, so they have to build up. It sucks when someone presses all the buttons on the elevator! You have to stop at each storey!  -  Some stupid kid has pushed all the buttons in the elevator. As it stops at all storeys you reach a pinnacle of impatience. Finally you reach your storey, the last one, at the pinnacle of the building.
column12: Tertre à tous les étages ! La nature itérative de l'escalier transpire dans ce caractère. Arrivé à chaque nouvel étage, nous découvrons un nouveau monde ; une sorte de nouveau tertre, l'étage suivant, apparaît encore, de sorte que tout étage a son propre tertre.  --

column11: This key word indicates a title of address to royalty. Its elements: pinnacle . . . compare . . . ground.  -    -  Your highness is the pinnacle of finesse compared to all of us commoners who are but like dirt on the ground.  -  His Highness, the main man at the Pinnacle, often compares those who live outside the city´s walls to dirt.
column12: On utilise en général ce kanji pour évoquer l’Empereur, placé sur un tertre incomparablement plus haut que le sol où nous nous trouvons.  --

column11: Pinnacle . . . rice . . . sunglasses.  -    -  America thinks it is the pinnacle of the world, looking down on all neighboring countries through its mirrored, aviator sunglasses.  -  All the neighboring communities to the Pinnacle have a major problem. The kids at the Pinnacle have a habit of throwing down rice from the city walls in all directions, so people in neighboring communities are forced to wear sunglasses all the time in order to avoid getting rice in their eyes.
column12: Tous les voisins se retrouvent au même endroit un beau jour, le cimetière près du tertre, et ils deviendront tous de nombreux feux follets.  --

column11: Pinnacle . . . ceiling . . . mouth . . . glass canopy . . . human legs . . . spike. You might want to compare the kanji for dissolve (Frame 1123).  -    -  The Pinnacle, to me, is a city that makes itself out to be perfect but is filled with dirty secrets that photographers are always trying to reveal (see dissolve (#1044) The city´s councilmen have isolated all professional photographers to make sure they don´t photograph these "dirty secrets". (which are up to your imagination).  -  The people of the pinnacle isolate themselves, dissolving any outside friendships.
column12: Tertre...marmite à trépied. La marmite à trépied a été apportée sur le tertre à l'occasion d'une cérémonie. Il faut se tenir à un certain écart de l'objet, faute de quoi le rite ne pourra être célébré.  --

column6: to hide, conceal, cover; to disappear, lurk; an open secret
column11: Pinnacle . . . vulture . . . broom . . . heart. Compare the element sat the right to the kanji for calm (Frame 1230).  -    -  The wheat farmer´s heart is calm (#1147) about the eagle not stealing his crops because of the broom scarecrow. But he still conceals all his wheat at The Pinnacle in case anyone else trys to steal it.  -  Move the broom with a vulture perched on top, and you´ll find the concealed entrance to the heart of The Pinnacle.
column12: Tertre...vautours...balai...cœur. Peut-être avez-vous entendu parler de ces tours du silence, tertres sur lesquels on place les corps des défunts, dissimulés à la vue, inaccessibles. Leurs entrailles, le cœur, sont comme « balayées » par les vautours vivant sur place.  --

column11: Wheat . . . vulture . . . broom . . . heart.  -    -  The farmer is calm knowing that his wheat fields are protected from vultures by his strawman with a heart (all the better to do the job properly).  -  This whole kanji is a picture of calmness. The wheat has been harvested and even the vultures sit calmly watching the humans sweep and clean-up after the harvest is over. Hearts are peaceful and calm at this time of the year. Even the days are calm without storm.
column12: Les éléments de ce kanji étaient déjà disponibles mais il est plus simple de le voir conjointement avec le précédent. Pour apaiser la faim des féroces vautours balayeurs de cœur, jetons-leur quelques poignées de grains de blé.  --

column11: Pinnacle . . . possess . . . ground.  -    -  Any attempt to possess the pinnacle will degenerate into a big land ("ground") war.  -  A degenerate doctor at The Pinnacle is doing illegal abortions. He´s so sick he just throws the aborted fetuses onto the ground far below. And like a possess demon, he keeps some tied to his side on a belt as trophies.
column12: Tertre...posséder...terre. Tentez de déceler une tension entre le fait de « posséder le tertre » en haut, et la terre, à laquelle tout retourne. L'élément important ici est bien la terre et non le tertre. Revoyez 1417 au besoin.  --

column11: Pinnacle . . . bound up . . . olden times.  -    -  The Pinnacle is actually bound up by supports from olden times. Eventually, they give out, and the whole thing starts to collapse.  -  The Pinnacle is supported by pilings which were bound up in olden times. One day when the bindings rot away, the whole thing will collapse. (tweaking dihutensoa´s story to work a little better for me).
column12: Tertre...emballage...anciens temps. Si vous vous imaginez découvrant au printemps, lors de votre première sortie sur le tertre, un animal pris au piège, emballé avant la première neige, en des temps anciens, les éléments trouveront une certaine logique.  --

column11: House . . . eight.  -  * As a primitive, this kanji uses an alternate form: the primitive for eight is replaced with that for human legs.  -  A black hole is a "House of Infinity". Infinity is of course represented by a sideways "8", but here we have a Japanese "8" instead.  -  Billiards anyone? House rules here state that the first person to pot the eight ball into the hole wins the game.
column12: Maison...huit - comprendre le tout. Revoir 8 pourra être utile. Au sein d'un kanji ce composant change : huit devient jambes.  --

column11: Hole . . . craft.  -    -  The craft of creating a black hole is in creating an emptiness which can attract things.  -  Hole-craft is the way of making empty spaces, like the sky.
column12: Creux, vide et ciel sont les principales notions rendues par le kanji s’écrivant trou...travail.  --

column11: House . . . human legs . . . elbow . . . heart.  -    -  The top primitive is similar to hole (#1316). A window is a hole (#1316) in your house that you occassionally sit next to while leaning on your ELBOW and gazing out, a picture of a lonely HEARTedness.  -  Anna stood inside the house 宀 on her human legs 儿 enjoying some private 厶 time, looking out the window and communing with the feelings that were in her heart 心. The first five strokes are actually 穴、あな, "hole," introduced later. 窓、まど, window; 窓口、まどぐち, ticket window; 車窓、しゃそう, car window.
column12: Le plus simple sera d’imaginer Juliette à sa fenêtre, représentée ici par un trou dans un mur. Ensuite apparaît son coude, et le cœur de Roméo, battant très fort au-dessous.  --

column11: Fingers . . . empty.  -    -  With my fingers, I punch in my bank code and withdraw some money from my account. And now it´s empty again, as usual!  -  If you find yourself in a fight with a karate master with no weapons or martial art skills, just your empty fingers, you should withdraw because 空手 (karate="empty hand") is more powerful than 控 (="empty fingers").
column12: Ce kanji qui porte le sens de modération mais aussi de noter, ou réserve, s’écrit doigts...vide : pour consommer avec modération, il suffit de garder les mains vides.  --

column11: Hole . . . St. Bernard dog.  -    -  When you stab something you often leave a big hole.  -  The police have recruited a special breed of St. Bernard that can lick the wounds of a stabbing victim. The bleeding will stop instantly, saving the victim´s life. One quirky side-effect, however, is that this treatment leaves behind a rather large hole...
column12: Trou...saint-bernard. Plus que l’idée de violence, tentez de voir dans l’image que vous créerez celle de surprise et de soudaineté. Par exemple, la soudaineté d'un saint-bernard sortant d'un embrasement sombre, un trou obscur caché au bas d'un mur.  --

column11: Hole . . . baseball.  -    -  Most research scientists have 9 holes.....two nostrils, two ears, a mouth, and four eyes...... :-).  -  Scientiest are researching , and have already found nine black holes !
column12: Trou...neuf.  Rechercher est une façon de creuser pour trouver du neuf.  --

column11: Hole . . . climax.  -    -  Sticking a plug up your hole will lead to stronger climaxes.  -  Here we have a Hole and Climax to mean PLUG UP. This is so butt-f**king easy, pun intended. If you PLUG UP her Hole, she will Climax.
column12: Trou...aboutissement. À obstruer est associé suffoquer, ainsi que azote. Il s'agit d'un trou qui aboutit sur une sorte de néant, d'où nous tenons l'idée d'obstruction.  --

column11: Hole . . . cut.  -    -  This more commonly means "steal", like how a thief cuts a hole to steal the jewels.  -  Stealth bombers cut holes through the enemy radar.
column12: Trou...couper. Pour réparer un carreau cassé, Woody Allen taille soigneu­sement un carré dans la vitre de la devanture d’un joaillier, et repart heureux, son carreau sous le bras. En ce sens il « coupe un trou » dans la devanture, et nous concluons qu’il s’est agit d’un cambriolage.   --

column11: Hole . . . water . . . ivy. The depression referred to here is a sunken place in the ground, rather than in one's spirits.  -    -  A depression is a hole in the ground. Water naturally collects there which provides moisture for vines to grow.  -  The depression in the ground become a trap: the hole was filled with water and covered with ivy.
column12: Trou...eau...sable. Le kanji qui concerne la concavité du sol décrit un trou comblé d'eau et de sable : prenez garde car cette cuvette semble cacher des sables mouvants !  --

column11: Hole . . . yield.  -    -  After Osama blew a hole in NY, the counterreaction forced him to yield and retreat into caverns.  -  In "The Empire Strikes Back", the Milennium Falcon flies into a large hole, of what they think is a cavern, because they don´t want to yield to the forces of the Empire. Turns out it´s not a cavern at all, actually...
column12: Une grotte est un trou où il faut se courber pour pouvoir s'y déplacer.  --

column6: to crush with the hand, press, squeeze, extract
column11: Fingers . . . hole . . . saw.  -    -  You have trouble squeezing your hand through the hole so you use a saw to enlarge it.  -  (Thanks DrJones) You squeeze the teats of the cow with your fingers but it´s your first try and you don´t have any milk come through the holes, so you take a saw and cut the teats to make bigger holes. Poor cow, this story squeezes my heart.
column12: Pour presser un citron, il faut d'abord le couper en deux avec une scie puis le prendre dans les doigts et appuyer pour en extraire le jus. Il reste alors un trou au milieu du citron pressé.  --

column11: Hole . . . sheep . . . oven fire.  -    -  Be sure to put a hole in that ceramic sheep before you put it over the fire. Otherwise, it´ll just explode in the kiln. (If you´ve never done ceramics before, it´s important that the object have a hole in it, or this really will happen.).  -  You put the sheep in the hole of the kiln and turn on the flames.
column12: Trou...mouton...feu. Le sens va du four culinaire au four industriel.  --

column11: Hole . . . somebody . . . bow.  -    -  Hard up = nothing but your body, living in a hole, with just a bow to hunt for your food.  -  Somebody so hard up for cash, the volunteered to explore a black hole with nothing but a bow.
column12: Il s’agit ici de « pousser les choses à fond », de se jeter « à corps perdu » Trou...individu...arc.   --

column11: Water . . . paper punch . . . tree.  -    -  If the groper´s "tree" goes up the girl´s miniskirt too deep, he´ll ejaculate fluid. (Sorry it´s kinda coarse but it works.).  -  Thrown in deep water, the Japanese School girl tries to reach a floating tree to save herself.
column12: Le grand filet est ici employé pour remonter un arbre des profondeurs d'un lac, l'eau. Voyez comme un tout petit trait fait une grande différence, transformant par son absence le trou en un filet.   --  En composant, seule la partie de droite sera employée.

column11: Fingers . . . paper punch . . . tree.  -    -  A pictograph of a japanese schoolgirl getting groped by perverts on the train. The fingers of course, a crown (her too short skirt) and her legs below (which to be honest are pretty thick like tree trunks).  -  Note: The combination "crown +human legs" appears seven times in Heisig. In four cases (nos. 323, 1327, 1328, 2920) the crown is above the human legs, and in the other three cases (1888, 2472, 2679) one leg passes through the crown. The naming is inconsistent, so I call the first pattern "Miss World" (who is wearing a crown she won due to her attractive human legs) and the second "garter" (one human leg passes through the crown and wears it as a garter).
column12: Doigts...profond. Il s'agit de « chercher un objet désiré ».  --

column11: Since this supposedly pictographic representation of a hill looks like anything but, picture a row of axes driven into the ground up to their heads, and see if that doesn't present a more memorable image of hill - at least a riskier one sliding down!  -    -  Excalibur is the sword planted in a rock. Lesser known AXCAHILLBUR is the axe planted on top of a hill.  -  At Capitol Hill proposals get axed on the floor.
column12: Bien que ceci soit le pictogramme d’une colline, la ressemblance n’est guère saisissante. Alors imaginez un tas de haches posées sur le plancher, et voyez si cela ne donne pas une image plus fidèle. Faites quelques glissades sur votre colline avant de continuer.  --

column11: Think of the key word as referring to proper names of mountains, but do not confuse with mountain pass (Frame 835). The elements are: hill . . . mountain.  -    -  I chopped off the point of the mountain with my axe. Now it is just a hill.  -  This actually means a high mountain. So, to cater to the keyword, it´s surely obvious (ahem) that if something gets such a fine title as Point, it must be more magnificent than the average mountain. It´s as if there was a hill on top of an average mountain, adding to its height.
column12: Une colline qui surmonte les montagnes est un pic.   --

column11: Hill . . . animal legs.  -    -  Listen up soldiers! We´re going to take that hill. You are no longer men with human legs. You are voracious animals, with animal legs! Got it? Animal legs! Now take that hill!  -  The hill is so steep that you almost have to have animal legs to walk on it. However, the soldiers have no problem because they´ve been trained to march there.
column12: Colline...pattes. Ces éléments pourront rappeller des souvenirs de marches interminables dans les collines, les pattes fourbues.  --

column11: Water . . . soldier.  -    -  Seacoast -> Coast Guard -> "water soldiers" lined up on the seacoast defending our shores.  -  Imagine Normandy after the strikes on the beach. The water of the entire seacoast dyed red with the blood of thousands of soldiers.
column12: Eau...soldat. Un clin d'œil sympathique aux soldats venus débarquer sur les plages de Normandie semble inscrit ici.  --  Chapitre trente-cinq  Le fil   LE fil compte parmi les composants les plus courants, et vous risquez de le placer là où il ne devrait pas être ou de l'omettre quand il est nécessaire. Il faudra donc toujours former une image claire. Heureusement, de même que le filet, le fil possède souvent une forte valeur symbolique et cela nous sera utile.

column11: Remember when your granny used to ask you to bend your arms at the elbows and hold them out so that she could use them like a rack to hold a skein of string or yarn (here thread) while she rolled it up into a little ball? Now can you see the two elbows (with the second stroke doubling up) at the top, and the character for little below?  -    -  I also went with Spiderman. However, in the cases where this primitive appears under other primitives, as opposed to on the left (I think there are ~5 times in this chapter) I´ve opted to use a similar character: Venom. This helps keep the positioning clear, especially on such characters as dainty (#1363) and accumulate (#1364).  -  You´ll be seeing this one a lot. Seriously.
column12: Repensez un instant à votre grand-mère qui vous demandait peut-être d'étendre les bras, pliés aux coudes, pour y placer un gros écheveau de laine. Puis elle enroulait ce fil en une petite pelote. Voyez-vous ici les deux coudes, dont le second trait est commun, puis le caractère petit au-dessous ?  --  En composant, il sera nécessaire de ne pas s'arrêter à la notion physique de fil, car l'observation montre qu'un sens symbolique de fil conducteur, ou de tradition, continuité, liaison entre passé, présent et avenir y est aussi inclus.

column11: Thread . . . kazoo.  -    -  Spiderman weaves his way through the skyline while listening to his theme song on his ipod. It is played, of course, by kazoos.  -  Play the kazoo magically and the thread will weave itself.
column12: Fil...tintamarre. Une courte visite dans une filature aidera.  --

column11: Thread . . . virtuous.  -    -  After a day being virtuouos and keeping the city safe, Spiderman´s outfit is in need of some repair. Luckily, as he can shoot out threads darning is very easy for him to do.  -  Darning is too obscure a word for me, I prefer to just think of it as repair. And obviously, repairing someones broken cloth things is a virtuous thing to do, and you need thread to do it.
column12: Fil...bien. Pour rapiécer, il faut du fil et que ça soit bien fait !  --

column11: Thread . . . inn.  -    -  After spending the night at an inn, spider man discovered to his dismay that his costume had shrunk in the wash, and no longer fit!  -  Don´t let the Inn wash your threads, they will shrink them!
column12: Au fil du temps, alors que sa renommée croît, on a peu à peu le sentiment que l’auberge rétrécit, tant le nombre des clients augmente.  --

column11: Cleverness . . . thread.  -    -  Important: Luxuriant does NOT mean luxurious, as the other stories indicate. Definition: abundant or lush in growth, as vegetation. When Venom realized he couldn´t beat Spider-Man in a fair fight, he showed his cleverness by spraying venom all over Spider-Man´s luxuriant garden.  -  Venom is covered in a luxuriant and surprisingly clever symbiotic suit, but it´s also the taskmaster for his every evil act.
column12: Prompt...fil. Fréquence et complexité sont les deux principales notions transmises par ce caractère. Quelqu'un prompt à la détente est susceptible de réagir à la moindre sollicitation, dès qu'on le sonne, avec le fil bien entendu. Nous établissons ainsi la relation avec la notion de fréquence, et complexité en sens corollaire.  --

column6: indulge in, give free reign to
column11: Thread . . . accompany.  -    -  When Spider-man does his amazing vertical wall climbing, a throng of photographers accompanies him to get a good shot of the action.  -  True vertical can be found by hanging a plumb line - a thread accompanied by a weight.
column12: Fil...soumis. N'obéissant qu'à la nature, le fil est soumis aux lois de la gravité et reste dans la direction verticale.  --

column11: Thread . . . spring.  -    -  This kanji is used for train lines. Spiderman does a hot spring tour of Japan using the train lines. You can see the Spidey costume hanging on the washing line as he enjoys the onsen.  -  Japan´s train lines are like threads that spring from Tokyo station.
column12: Fil...source. Le sens tout à fait général de ligne est compris dans ce kanji.  --

column11: Thread . . . sovereign.  -    -  The sovereign appears to be ruling, but in reality someone behind him (for instance his wife) has a thread around his throat, and if he dares to make a decision she doesn´t like, she starts pulling the thread and tightens it around his throat.  -  (astridtops) Spiderman managed to get behind the sovereign. (pick your favourite nowadays country ruler who isn´t doing a good job). Spidey has tightend a web around the sovereing´s throat. As long as the sovereign says what spidey whispers, he will be fine. Sovereign yelping : ´ we will draw are troops back! and we will spend more money on healthcare, schools and less on wars!´ Spidey whispering: ´ If you continue at this pace, you might be doing good things AND the people will like you.´.
column12: Fil...souverain. Si vous avez encore en mémoire l’histoire grotesque du souverain à la vaisselle, vous le verrez ici resserrer d’un cran son tablier.  --

column11: Thread . . . turkey.  -    -  Hey, Spidey! Eat that turkey if you want, but make sure you eat some fibers: you want spidey threads, don´t ya?  -  If you want to increase your fiber intake, just leave on those threads that are used to sew up the stuffed turkey and eat them too.
column12: Le sens propre de fibre, ainsi que le sens figuré de conservation des choses établies sont inclus dans ce kanji. Alors pardonnez-moi de ressortir une fois de plus la dinde du four, et sa viande un peu fibreuse, en précisant que c’est par une sorte de fibre traditionnaliste qu'elle réapparaît à chaque fête de fin d'année.  --

column11: Eye . . . fiber.  -    -  Lots of girls in Japan wear gauze patches over one eye made of course white fibers. They think it is cute, and I must admit, I have come to think so too.  -  Rocky won the match but left with a nasty eye injury, and needs some gauze for it. I use a modified version of the Rocky theme song to remember this one -- "the eye and the fiber".
column12: L’objet dont il est ici question est une sorte de mousseline, fait de soie très fine : voile...fibre.   --

column11: Thread . . . east.  -    -  You practice your Japanese skills in a discussion thread with lots of people from the Far East (since many of the people who are interested in studying Japanese are Asian).  -  Spidey stays on the east side of the city to practice. The West Side is too dangerous.
column12: Fil-tradition...Est-Japon. La méthode employée par les petits Japonais pour apprendre les caractères semble inscrite dans ce kanji.  --

column11: Thread . . . puppet. Although we usually think of a thong as coming at the end of a piece of string, this character's meaning allows for it to come at the beginning as well.  -    -  Spiderman has a secret fetish, he likes nothing better than to dress his lovedoll in a thong. Wierd, eh!  -  A thread is just the right size for a puppets thong.
column12: Fil...(prendre) corps. Les deux bouts, endroits où le fil prend corps, sont représentés par ce kanji.  --

column11: Thread . . . sell.  -    -  If you attach strings to the things you sell, you will be able to continue making profit from them even after the fact.  -  Even though Peter Parker has become Spiderman, he continues to sell pictures that he takes as a photographer.
column12: Notre vieux professeur muni de son filet de vendeur continue sa route ; il reprend le fil de son activité.  --

column11: Thread . . . meeting.  -    -  There´s never a picture of Spiderman meeting Peter Parker... I wonder why?  -  When all the Threads finally Meet the Picture will emerge...
column12: Fil...assemblée. Un gigantesque patchwork apparaît en principe dans votre imagination à la lecture des éléments.  --

column11: Thread . . . allot.  -    -  Spidey is alloted the biggest crime fighter jurisdiction in NYC because his OVERALL arrest record is the best.  -  According to Greek mythology, there´s a thread alloted to everyone, and its length is the overall determinant of your fate.
column12: Fil...répartir.  Gouverner est une façon de « tenir les ficelles » et répartir les tâches, pour attribuer à chacun les responsabilités qui lui incombent.  --

column11: Thread . . . mingle.  -    -  Spiderman hates going to parties and having to mingle. He wants to strangle someone after just a little small talk.  -  At the elegant cocktail party of VIP's, the spy, dressed like everyone else in formal evening wear, sneaks in and strangles his victim with a very thin wire - a thread. Afterwards he mingles in with the crowd and disappears.
column12: Fil...échange.  Essorer consiste à échanger l'eau que contient le tissu contre de l'air sec.  --

column11: Thread . . . fit.  -    -     Spiderman wanted to be a salaryman, but the suit just didn't fit him.  -  Spiderman has so little free time in his schedule that he is unable to fit in a job with a good salary.
column12: Alimenter, c'est ici attribuer le nécessaire à quelqu'un ou quelque chose pour lui permettre de remplir la tâche, ici le fil, qui lui correspond.  --

column11: Thread . . . each.  -    -  When threads become entwined, each thread is tangled to another.  -  Spiderman entwines each villain in a tangled mess of spidersilk.
column12: Fil...chacun. Le fil  enlace chacun des objets présents.  --

column11: Thread . . . aerosol can.  -    -  Ok, here, you have to think of the phrase "TIE the knot" , which means a wedding (this kanji is used in the marriage compound 結婚 けっこん ). Now, at US weddings, it ends with the couple driving away with cans being dragged behind the car. So here, think of SPIDERMAN, who will TIE the knot with Mary Jane. At his wedding, Spider THREAD attached (or TIED) to SPRAYCANS are being drug behind the limo as they drive off.  -  Spiderman and a fan have a competition to see who can tie up the most enemies fastest. Spidey´s using his webs and the fan is using an aerosol can of silly string. So far they are tied.
column12: Fil...bombe aérosol. Imaginez les bombes aérosol utilisées lors des fêtes foraines, et qui projettent une sorte de fil  nouant les spectateurs en une masse homogène.  --

column11: Thread . . . winter.  -    -  This winter is so cold that spiderman´s web gets brittle! Could this be the end of spiderman?  -  The thread of life begins with the spring and ends with the winter.
column12: Fil...hiver. Lorsque les choses ne tiennent qu’à un fil, et que l’on pense ne « pas passer l’hiver », on n’est pas loin de la fin.   --

column11: Threads . . . outstretched hands.  -    -  This Kanji is the same ones used in the Japanese Language proficiency tests; i.e. ikkyuu (一級) The Kanji doesnt describe class as in a "class of students" or "classroom," but rather a grade of quality or ability. ---------- Spiderman is taking the JLPT Level 1. In desperation he REACHES OUT to grab his friend´s answer sheet next to him, who seems to be doing well. The other test takers are obviously a class above him. Looks like this test is above his class of knowledge.  -  We can almost see the outstreched hands of the lower classes wearing just a few threads in this kanji.
column12: Fil-tradition...s'étendre. La tradition veut que les mains s'étendent le plus possible, pour gravir le plus vite possible les diverses classes sociales.  --

column11: Thread . . . snake.  -    -  In a CHRONICLE the THREAD of the story can twist and turn like a SNAKE.  -  Worst fan fiction ever....SPIDERMAN joins the CHRONICLES of narnia to battle a big SNAKE!!
column12: Fil-continuité...soi. Au travers de la chronique personnelle, on recherche le fil de sa propre personnalité. Revoyez 579.  --

column11: Thread . . . craft.  -    -  After Spider-Man is whacked in the head with a I-beam, crimson blood flows from the wound.  -  A person's first piece of thread craft is often stained crimson due to bleeding from the needle wounds sustained in the process.
column12: Fil...travail. On place un fil rouge cramoisi de protection autour de la zone de travaux pour que les badauds n'entrent pas.  --

column11: Thread . . . inside.  -    -  Have you heard about patients who have surgery and the doctor mistakenly leaves a medical instrument INSIDE the patient’s body and proceeds to stitch up the patient’s incisions with stitching THREAD? Can you say “malpractice SETTLEMENT”?　.  -  Spider-Man was working as a surgeon´s assistant. By accident, he threw his spider webs inside the patient, causing his death. Fortunately, the hospital reached an out-of-court settlement with the victim´s family.
column12: Fil...dedans. Le sens de ce kanji comprend l’idée très générale de placer quelque chose en un endroit déterminé, pour qu’il puisse être directement utilisé. Pensez par exemple à vous faire installer la fibre optique ; alors les éléments fil...intérieur trouveront une certaine logique.  --

column11: For the kanji that means the spinning of thread and other fibers we have the elements: thread . . . compass.  -    -  Spiderman can spin his webs in any direction.  -  You keep me spinning right round, baby right round, like a compass baby. Spidey is making a retro 80s music video, spinning right round on his giant compass, singing his favourite song.
column12: Lorsqu'on file la laine, tout se passe comme si chacun des fils de l'écheveau possédait une boussole, pour s'orienter correctement selon l'axe de la fibre. On croit deviner dans ce kanji la meilleure méthode pour fabriquer les meilleures fibres de carbone, dont les Japonais furent les premiers producteurs.  --

column11: Thread . . . part.  -    -  It is easy for arguments to get distracted from the main thread by a tendency to part threads (splitting hairs).  -  Spiderman got distracted when someone yelled, "Spiderman, wait a minute." He turned around and flew into a building. ("part" also means "minute").
column12: Fil...portion. Une portion de fil, même courte, s’emmêle si facilement qu’elle nous donne peu de « fil à retordre » pour retenir ce kanji. Confusion est un sens associé.  --

column6: continue, carry on; hand down; to join
column11: Thread . . . seduce.  -    -  Spiderman seduces all the girls he´s introduced to.  -  You only get one chance to make a first impression, so make sure you're wearing nice threads when you get introduced to a girl. Otherwise you might have trouble seducing her.
column12: Fil...faire venir à soi. Le personnage faisant les présentations est muni de deux fils, à l’aide desquels il fait venir à lui les deux partenaires qu’il présente l’un à l’autre.  --

column10: Cheminement, latitude, temps qui s'écoule, trajet, exécution d'un travail, soutra
column11: Thread . . . spool.  -    -  The word ‘sutra’ literally means a rope or thread that holds things together. Here we see that it is a spool that is holding the threads together.  -  Spiderman is intriqued by some of the positions of the karma sutra, but reluctant to take part in an sutra orgy as he´d have to reveal his soiled underwear.
column12: Avec notre toupie, ici une sorte de gyroscope associé à une sorte de fil d’Ariane, nous suivons sans nous perdre un instant divers cheminements temporels, spaciaux et spirituels. C’est qu’en effet sont réunies dans ce kanji les notions de latitude, temps qui s’écoule, trajet, exécution d’un travail, et enfin soutra, le « cheminement bouddhique ».  --

column11: Thread . . . monkey.  -    -  Monkeys are very adept at swinging around trees. But when they met Spiderman, who could swing around even better than they could, they all quickly addressed him as sire.  -  From the fairy tale ‘emperor’s new clothes.’ sire, i know you say it's made of the finest threads, but i’m afraid someone has made a monkey of you.
column12: Fil-tradition...je vous dis. Le gentilhomme dont il est question ici est très posé, respecte la tradition et s’adresse à vous très poliment.  --

column11: Consider for a moment the etymology of the word "promise" in order to notice its roots in the activity of putting one thing (e.g., one's word of honor) in place of another (e.g., the fulfillment of a task). For as it turns out, this character also means "to abridge, economize, and abbreviate" - all activities that involve putting one thing in place of another. With that in mind, we may now work with the elements: thread . . . ladle.  -    -  He tied a thread around the ladle as a reminder of his promise to do more house work.  -  Spiderman promised to get Aunt Mae´s ladle back. He started to do a blood oath by spilling drops of blood but Aunt Mae stopped him and bound up the wound. "It´s only a ladle Peter".
column12: Fil...louche. Pour faire environ un kilomètre de fil de soie, il faut environ douze cocons déroulés en même temps, et qui tiendraient aisément dans une bonne louche.Si vous me donnez la louche convenablement remplie, je peux donc vous promettre un kilomètre de bon fil. Il faudrait aussi le chaudron, l'eau, du sable, et quelques ustensiles, mais je m'égare, car je voulais simplement préciser que promettre est un sens associé de ce kanji.  --

column11: Thread . . . brains.  -    -  Dainty women would always rather work with thread than in a field.  -  Spider-Man used to just be a dainty, brainy nerd.
column12: Fil...cerveau. Une allusion aux neurones, les « fils de la matière grise » est bienvenue, car elle rend bien le double sens du kanji : menu, ainsi que long et fin.   --

column11: Rice field . . . threads. Make use of the position of the elements to distinguish this kanji from that of the previous frame.  -    -  When you accumulate knowledge in your brain, neural pathways are constructed. All those pathways end up like a huge ball of thread tangled together. The more knowledge you accumulate the more threads you throw into the mix!!  -  (dingomick) Venom is upset because Spidey is just that much brainier than he is! He chooses to accumulate as many brains as he can, snatching them out of people´s heads and storing them on top of his own, till there´s just one massive brain on top of his head!
column12: Rizière...fil. Pour ne pas confondre ce kanji avec le précédent, imaginez-vous tirant à vous, à l’aide du fil, l’ensemble du riz amassé dans la rizière. La même technique s'applique désormais à l'entière production d'une entreprise, amassée par quelques-uns.  --

column6: large rope, cable; rules, laws; to demand, to exact; to search, inquire; isolated
column11: Chapel (see frame 930) . . . thread.  -    -  A coaxial cord has a needle-like pin, a crown cap for screwing it in, and insulation made of thread.  -  Venom has been captured and given the ultimate torture: they forced a crown of needles on his head and attached it to an electrical cord, which they are about to plug into an outlet...
column12: Le mieux sera de voir le pictogramme d’un puits, constitué d’un axe (l’aiguille) puis la margelle (la couronne), et enfin le câble, qui vous permet d’aller puiser ce dont vous avez besoin. Puiser est un sens dérivé.  --

column11: This kanji, meaning universal or widespread, is composed of three elements: thread . . . public . . . heart.  -    -  Spiderman could not achieve general acceptance by the media even after winning the public´s heart.  -  General or universal refers to the common thread running through the public's heart.
column12: Fil...public...cœur. Revoyez l'image créée en 863.  --

column11: Thread . . . white . . . towels.  -    -  Spiderman´s polyethylene suit starts to ride up after a while, so he always looks forward to the white cotton towels he wears while lounging around his apartment.  -  Cotton is the preferred thread for making white towels.
column12: Fil...blanc...serviette. Nous avons ici une sorte de petite définition de dictionnaire, qui décrit le type de matière, la couleur et l'emploi qu'on peut en faire.  --

column11: Thread . . . mouth . . . flesh.  -    -  Silk threads are coming out of the caterpillar's mouth to cover its flesh while it transforms into a cocoon.  -  Spider-man loves to run his mouth all over Mary Jane´s silky flesh.
column12: Fil...bouche...chair. Les deux derniers éléments pourront se fondre pour donner l’image de la « filière animale » que possède le ver à soie.   --

column11: Thread . . . goods . . . tree.  -    -  Winding thread around wooden goods (paper) to ready them for safe transport.  -  After stopping a bank heist, Spiderman is seen winding his webbing around the stolen goods to trap them in a tree until the police arrive to take them back.
column12: Fil...pantin. Notre pantin désarticulé est devenu l’axe d’une bobine sur laquelle nous embobinons le fil.   --

column11: Thread . . . rice . . . fishhook. Compare frame 1218.  -    -  A poor chinese fisherman could expect to inherit: the thread for his pole, a hook for catching something to eat, and some rice to live off of. (not concentrating on stroke order, sorry if that throws anyone off). (Adapted from bigloui,12-4-2006).  -  Spider-Man is hooked on rice--it´s all he inherited from his Uncle Ben. (thanks Nukemarine).
column12: Fil...hameçon...riz. Revoyez au besoin le kanji vu en 1229, et notez comment ce kanji en est la continuité : le fil ici ne fait que prendre le relais, ou assurer la succession, en accrochant l'hameçon garni d'un grain de riz.  --

column11: Thread . . . broom . . . rice grains.  -    -  Spiderman's nemesis the Green Goblin is in a slump; He's replaced his glider with a broom and is throwing grains of rice instead of bombs.  -  Spiderman's fight against the green goblin was recorded on videotape (录, see 録 (#1226) and sold. You know the film, don't you? It's no hollywood movie - it's true!
column12: Fil...balai...irrigation. Imaginons un vert champêtre. Le fil est cette cordelette qui nous permet de bien aligner les plants quand nous repiquons au printemps ; avec le balai, nous nettoyons les allées du jardin et l’eau d’irrigation nous assure que les plantes resteront vertes pendant l’été.  --

column10: Véranda, intime affinité, bordure, lisière d'un tissu
column11: Thread . . . broom . . . sow.  -    -  There once was a lonely little pig that constantly followed Spiderman, always nuzzling his leg and oinking tenderly. Spiderman finally caved in and decided to keep the little pig under one condition: the pig was to take a broom and sweep up all of Spiderman´s leftover threads after having fought crime. The pig felt such affinity for Spiderman, he happily accepted—and did a good job too.  -  Certain people have an affinity for romantic partners who are handy with thread and a broom - it is of no consequence if they look like pigs. hmm...
column12: Fil...balai...truie. Cet étrange kanji définit à la fois la notion d'intime affinité, de bordure ou lisière d'un tissu, et de véranda ; tous ces termes représentent la même chose. Imaginons une véranda très particulière pour retenir les composants. Une truie y fait le ménage en permanence, balayant les moindres poussières ou morceaux de fil qui traînent. Associons ensuite l'idée de véranda à celle de bordure, puisqu'une véranda se trouve en bordure de la maison. Enfin, notons que l'intime affinité entre deux personnes est atteinte lorsque les « bordures de leurs sentiments » se touchent bord à bord (ces deux personnes pourraient alors passer d'heureuses heures à discuter dans la véranda, et nous retomberions sur nos pieds !).  --

column11: Thread . . . glass canopy . . . animal horns . . . perish.  -    -  Spiderman traps The Rhino under the hood of his famous netting, where even Rhino´s horns can not break free, in fact if the netting did not dissappear after a few hours then Rhino might even perish in there.  -  You use a 糸 to make a net shaped like a hood. A stray animal got caught in it by its horns and perished.
column12: Fil...cloche...cornes...décédé. Ce caractère est plus simple qu'il n'y paraît, parce que nous en connaissons bien les morceaux. En plus du fil dans lequel ce filet est fabriqué, nous trouvons à droite une forme qui rappelle le filet vu au début du livre, page 100, où nous disions que , , , ,  représentent toutes des filets. Ici, la grande cloche  est une nouvelle déformation du même objet ; il s'agit véritablement du filet, dans lequel nous voyons même l'animal décédé. En fin de compte, ce kanji décrit le matériau, la forme et l'emploi du filet : encore une définition de dictionnaire !  --

column11: Slave . . . crotch . . . thread.  -    -  Whenever Venom is tense, he loses control of his sex drive and becomes a slave to his crotch.  -  You´d be tense too if you were a slave and your owner removed the threads covering your crotch.
column12: Un indélicat a fixé un fil à la main droite de cet esclave, peut-être pour tenter de le dérober. Le fil est alors extrêmement tendu, comme l’est la situation.  --

column11: Footprint . . . spoon . . . thread.  -    -  Stop sitting for so long - or else you'll get those purple threads (veins) on your legs from bad circulation. [link purple with those huge purple, bulging, crawling, worm-like varicose veins .....].  -  Why is your ass purple? Well, I stopped and sat for a bit on a pile of thread... (I guess it was freshly dyed).
column12: Ici...fil. Ici commence un fil. Au début, le fil est si fin et ténu qu'on n'en voit qu'une couleur, par interférence, le violet qui est la dernière couleur de l'arc en ciel.  --

column11: Threads . . . acupuncturist.  -    -  Spidey received good word that the acupuncturist working down the road was actually the evil Doctor Octopus! Spidey headed over to the clinic, and trussed the acupuncturist Doc Oc up using the maniac´s own metal limbs!  -  Because people are so afraid of the procedure, string has to be used by the acunpunturist to truss up his victims, er, patients.
column12: Fil...docteur. Un docteur des nœuds vous a ficelé à un poteau sur une route déserte, en utilisant le fil électrique qui court d’un poteau à l’autre: retenez ce kanji avant qu’il ne rétablisse le courant.  --

column11: Thread . . . eels.  -    -  The tortoise has escaped! We tied it up with a straw rope, but all that´s left of the rope are some torn threads, and the unbound tortoise is nowhere to be found. (Note that the right half here is not "eels". This is (in my opinion) a mistake in the RTK book, as we already decided in waterfall (#537) to refer to the simplified form of dragon as "eels". It is much better to call the right half of this character an "unbound tortoise".).  -  When Spiderman fights the giant tortoise, he grabs a straw rope from the edges of the sumo ring and swings it at his head. However, the tortoise quickly tucks his head back into his shell to avoid the blow (hence no head on the tortoise).
column12: Fil...tortue sans tête. Pour ne pas se tordre le cou, la tortue rentre la tête lorsqu’elle fait ses exercices de saut à la corde sur la plage le matin.  --

column11: Cocoon . . . muscle.  -    -  In its infancy, a butterfly is protected by a cocoon, as it doesn´t yet have any power of its own.  -  During their infancy, children are often wrapped up tight like a cocoon (i.e. in those Snugli carriers) and supported by the muscle of their parents.
column12: Cocon...muscle. Voyez la tendre enfance comme cette période de la vie où l’on vit protégé par les bras des adultes, dont les muscles forment une sorte de cocon protecteur.  --

column11: Line . . . cocoon . . . walking legs.  -    -  Column of walking legs (caterpillar) getting into a cocoon, about to leave its past self behind.  -  after a grub goes through the cocoon stage, it leaves its walking legs behind for a life of flight.
column12: Ligne...cocon...jambes qui marchent. Le sens spatial, autant que temporel, est compris. Après le cocon, et en droite ligne, arrive l’insecte et ses jambes qui marchent.   --

column11: Two cocoons . . . mountain. Observe how the two vertical strokes of the mountain are extended upwards to serve as a kind of enclosure.  -    -  The villagers haven´t the faintest idea that giant coccoons resting in the mountain are soon to hatch.  -  Frodo and Sam fainted in the mountains and the spider wrapped them in cacoons.
column12: Deux cocons...montagne. Observez bien les deux cocons isolés l’un de l’autre, ainsi que de l’extérieur, au sein de la montagne. Notez également que les traits latéraux de la montagne remontent haut sur les bords, renforçant l’idée d’isolation. Tracez d’abord le trait central et les deux cocons, puis refermez l’ensemble sur les deux cocons.  --

column6: how many? how much?; a few, some
column11: Two cocoons . . . person . . . fiesta.  -  * As a primitive, this kanji will mean an abacus, the bead-instrument used in the Orient to calculate how many.  -  It is a little awkward when you are at a fiesta and the host serves some rare delicacy, like moth cocoons, the guests must decide how many it would be polite to eat. You do the math in your head and it comes out to two cocoons per person. This is why the horizontal line is a fraction bar with two cocoons on the top, and one person the bottom.  -  How many went to the party? Two aliens and one person (I feel sorry for that person).
column12: Deux cocons...se changer en. La question est de savoir en combien de kilomètres de fil se changerons les deux cocons.   --

column11: Tree . . . abacus.  -    -  An abacus is a mechanism made of wood used to calculate how many ´anythings´.  -  To avoid confusing with contraption (#677), focus on the "ism" of mechanism. For example, fetishism refers to having a fetish; mechanism here refers to having a mecha-like property, where mecha is a type of anime robot that can transform itself. Imagine a mecha that can transform itself between two forms: a huge immovable tree (as a form of defense) and a gigantic marching abacus that smashes enemies between its giant beads.
column12: Arbre...combien. La question est de savoir combien il faut d’arbres pour fabriquer un métier à tisser. Puis on songera que le sens du kanji a évolué vers mécanique et organique.  --

column11: Top hat . . . cocoon.  -    -  What could be more mysterious than a cocoon in a top hat trying to sneak in...? (Pimitive: GANDALF).  -  The invisible man in his top hat and cocoon of white bandages is the most mysterious man in the world.
column12: Chapeau haut de forme...cocon. Que va-t-il sortir du cocon placé sous le chapeau haut de forme ? En complément de mystérieux, nous trouvons aussi sombre.  --

column11: Mysterious . . . rice field.  -    -  The livestock are disappearing! I´ve placed Gandalf over the rice field to protect them.  -  This mysterious rice field grows not only rice, but livestock too! Picture little pigs and chickens growing right out of the ground, among the rice plants. How bizarre!
column12: Mystérieux...cerveau - champ. À quoi pense le bétail en voyant tant de têtes le regarder depuis le train qui passe ?  --

column11: Flowers . . . livestock.  -    -  One sneaky farmer wanted to amass a large collection of livestock. We all know that cows like to eat flowers, so he planted lines of flowers leading to his own fields. The livestock followed the lines, eating the flowers one by one, and amassed in his field.  -  Kobe beef. The Japanese amass a fortune pampering livestock feeding them flowers, offering beer, playing music and giving them massages… RTK2:　チク　蓄電池　ちくでんち(battery cell)…　Pure Group:　畜1384.
column12: Végétaux...bétail. La vache (bétail) qui rumine accumule une grosse quantité de végétaux dans sa panse avant de les remâcher.  --

column11: Bow . . . mysterious.  -    -  A magic bow that only Gandalf can yield: there is no bowstring on it, and he uses his magic to fire arrows.  -  A bow with a mysterious invisible bowstring.
column12: Arc...mystère. On pose ici la question du mystère de l'arc, et de sa corde qui résiste à tant de tension.  --

column11: Fingers . . . mysterious . . . turkey. Note that the top hat is extended across both elements, though it belongs only to the cocoon. This means that you may either use mysterious - as we did here - or take the three elements separately.  -    -  A mysterious turkey with human fingers wants to hug me... I will never go to Tokyo Disneyland again!  -  Imagine Gandalf hugging a turkey....ouch! It bit off his finger!
column12: Doigt...chapeau haut de forme...cocon...dinde. Etrange étreinte sous ce chapeau haut de forme, mais chut ! laissons-les, dit-on le doigt posé sur la bouche. Remarquez la déformation du cocon dans l’effort.  --

column11: Water . . . double-mysterious. Note the doubling up of the element for top hat in the primitive for mysterious and assign it a special image, as it will come up in the next two frames.  -    -  Water is doubly mysterious. It´s in all our nourishment...and yet, it´s really not nourishing at all.  -  Going off the idea of the right side meaning rapid growth/increase of small objects, I´ve decided to make the right side be Gremlins, those little mysterious creatures that double rapidly. Gremlins find water a little too nourishing, as it makes them instantly multiply.
column12: Eau...double mystère. L’eau est en fait le premier aliment : on meurt de déshydratation bien avant de mourir de faim. Le second mystère nous demande de comprendre pourquoi l'eau étant si abondante, nous risquons d'en manquer cruellement.  --

column11: Double-mysterious . . . heart.  -    -  Here we see the DOUBLE-MYSTERIOUS Siamese twins again, at the MERCY of the machines that pump blood through their veins, since the single HEART they share won't do the job...  -  Here we see the DOUBLE-MYSTERIOUS Siamese twins again, at the MERCY of the machines that pump blood through their veins, since the single HEART they share won´t do the job...
column12: Double mystère...sentiments. L'affection est ce sentiment mystérieux unissant deux personnes et qui est basé sur la réciprocité du sentiment.  --

column11: Stone . . . double-mysterious.  -    -  A magnet is a rock with two sides; one that mysteriously pushes and one that pulls; doubly mysterious. (see astridtops´ story).  -  I found some stones on the siamese twins. Turns out the stones were magnetic, and they weren´t siamese twins at all!
column12: Pierre...double mystère. Pourquoi deux aimants s’attirent, puis se répui­sent si l’on en retourne un constitue un mystère. Pourquoi ce kanji signifie aussi porcelaine en constitue un second.  --

column11: The single stroke added to the beginning of the primitive for thread gives the image of threads woven into a single cord. Hence the meaning, lineage.  -  * As a primitive, we shall give this kanji the meaning of yarn, as the uniting of many threads into a single strand is most obvious with yarn.  -  A single drop of your blood holds the proof of the unbroken thread of your lineage.  -  Spiderman´s lineage (who his family is etc...) can be found in his DNA in a drop of blood. The villain that gets blood of Spidey will be able to find out who is family and lineage is. be carfefull spidey...
column12: Le trait unique ajouté au caractère fil donne l’image de fils tressés en une corde unique. D’où le sens de lignée.  --

column11: Person . . . yarn.  -    -  Mister T gets a DNA test, and discovers that he was meant to be the person in charge after all.  -  The person in charge usually must come from a long standing lineage of persons in charge.
column12: Tintin...lignée. En un sens, Tintin est chargé de toute la lignée des très nombreux commentaristes de l’œuvre de Georges Remi. (Selon la recension de la Bibliothèque de Moulinsart, ces ouvrages dépassent la centaine, ce n’est pas rien !)  --

column11: Child . . . yarn.  -    -  Your grandchild is the child of your DNA.  -  Your child continues the family lineage by passing on your DNA, giving you a grandchild.
column12: Enfant...lignée. Il s’agit des descendants de seconde géné­ration.  --

column11: Prefecture . . . yarn . . . heart.  -    -  The prefecture has suspended all DNA research for heart disease because of corruption. All involved will be suspended by their wrists.  -  There's a suspension bridge connecting one of the prefectures to the Japanese heartland. The supporting cables of the bridge actually look like DNA double-helices. That's Japan for you!
column12: Département...lignée...sentiments. Pensez à être suspendu aux ordres venus d’en haut (le département), et vous aurez bientôt le sentiment que l’information doit passer par toute une lignée d’intermédiaires, par la voie hiérarchique.  --

column11: Gone . . . stamp.  -    -  [instead; on the contrary; rather] Gone is the time for stamps - use e-mail instead.  -  If you tried to attach money to an envelope to pay for postage it would be GONE before it arrived at the post office. That´s why we use STAMPS instead.
column12: Parti...tampon. Imaginons un livre emprunté à (parti de) la bibliothèque, à la place duquel le bibliothécaire a placé un « fantôme » (le tampon). Ce fantôme nous invite à rapporter le livre emprunté.  --

column11: Part of the body . . . instead. This character has more or less the same meaning as that for leg learned back in frame 1372. It can also indicate the part of the legs from the shins down, which explains the choice of the key word.  -    -  Shins are the part of the body that one uses instead of one´s eyes, for finding furniture in the dark. (Ouch!).  -  Shins are the part of the body that Japanese traditionally sit on instead of their asses.
column12: Partie du corps...rapporter. On utilisera de préférence ce kanji pour définir les pattes d'un meuble.  --

column11: The left primitive is a union of a horse and footprint. To the right, the stamp.  -    -  Wholesale refers to the sale of goods in quantity to retailers for resale. When this kanji was invented, large loads of goods needed to be transported by horses who left steep footprints because of the weight they carried. The wholesale goods needed a special stamp to indicate that they were legal for resale.  -  If you need horseshoes (shoes that fit your horse´s footprint), buy them at the wholesale shop. They lick and paste stamps in your membership card so you can get free merchandise later.
column12: À gauche se trouve la réunion du cheval et d'une trace de pas : un cheval qui piaffe ; à droite, le tampon. Nous sommes au bureau d'octroi d'une grande ville, avec une cargaison pour la vente en gros dans le tombereau. Le cheval piaffe en attendant que l'employé du bureau d'octroi appose le tampon sur la feuille de voiture.  --

column11: Line . . . wholesale.  -    -     At noon, they stop selling fish in Japanese markets at full price and stamp it wholesale.  -  If a trader has an honorable reputation- then people will line up to buy his wholesale goods.
column12: Ligne...vente en gros. Vos marchandises sont honorables, vous dit l'employé ; alors vous commandez au cheval de suivre la ligne-route menant à la ville.   --  Ce kanji signifie à la fois commander et honorable, bien que ce dernier sens soit parfois caricaturé. Il faut surtout y voir une marque de respect de l'interlocuteur.

column11: Flesh . . . stamp . . . crotch. Note how the stamp is stretched out here.  -    -  It´s customary to cover the flesh with clothing, but some designs are so outrageous they´re not bigger than a stamp that just covers your crotch.  -  Modern clothing shows a lot of flesh -- some is practically no more than a postage stamp covering your crotch!
column12: L'habit ne fait pas le moine, dit-on, mais ce kanji semble bien annoncer le contraire et ce n'est pas surprenant, tant l'usage de l'uniforme est courant au Japon. L'habillement dirige donc l'ensemble des parties du corps. Ce kanji signifie aussi avaler (un médicament ou une bouffée de fumée de tabac).  --

column6: life; destiny, fate, luck; an order, instruction
column11: This character connotes life in general, but also the particular life that is fated one by virtue of the distinctive character with which one is born. Its elements are: fit . . . stamp. The bottom portion of fit is nudged to the left in order to make room for the stamp.  -    -  When you´re born, your fate is measured, fitted, and stamped onto your soul. Good luck defying it.  -  Your ability to resist FATE can be fit on a postage stamp.
column12: Correspondre...tampon. La partie inférieure de correspondre se serre du côté gauche : sa destinée est de laisser la place au tampon.  --

column11: Meeting . . . chop-seal.  -    -  (re: dingomick) "These are your orders," declares the general while passing out documents at the meeting. As everyone started to leave, the general exclaims "Oh wait! I need to certify these orders!" and went around stamping each paper with his personal chop-seal.  -  These are your orders, declares the general at the meeting as he stamps them with his chop-seal. (Primitive: chop-seal imaged as a papal ring, the one´s they would press into wax as their official seal. Also a cattle brand.).
column12: Assemblée...sceau. Au Japon, tout se fait selon une procédure bien établie. Avant l'exécution d'un ordre, chaque entité participant à la réalisation du travail placera son sceau sur un document prévu à cet effet.  --

column11: Rain . . . orders.  -    -  The amount of people that can order the rain to rain.  -  Despite the rain, the zero pilot flies on. He has kamikaze orders.
column12: Pluie...ordre. Les pluies japonaises souvent fortes donnent en quelque sorte l'ordre de remettre à zéro la situation dans la région subissant les intempéries.  --

column11: This character is used to express the years of one's age. Its elements: teeth . . . orders.  -    -  You know you are fast approaching a ripe old AGE when you get ORDERS from the dentist to get new TEETH.  -  This has the nuance of a life milestone. Here it's represented by the life-cycle of teeth: In childhood, your teeth give the orders, growing whenever they want. As a teenager, we give orders to the teeth, by putting braces on them. In old age, we order new teeth!
column12: Une campagne du ministère japonais de la santé donne l'ordre, ou disons recommande, à chacun d'avoir encore vingt dents véritables à l'âge de quatre-vingts ans.  --

column11: Ice . . . orders.  -    -  To keep your water cool, just order some ice.  -  The Japanese boss gives an order at the meeting: eat ice to stay cool (since they won´t be running the air conditioning anymore).
column12: Glace...ordre. Le sens figuré que l’on connaît en français, concernant le caractère froid, existe aussi en japonais.  --

column11: Orders . . . head.  -    -  Two cowboys are crossing a state limit. One says to him “Did you know that in this Jurisdiction there are Orders to get your head?”, so he takes out his gun and shoots him. He claims the reward afterwards. (Thanks Fuaburisu).  -  Orders are given by the head person in any jurisdiction.
column12: Ordre...tête. La tête gère le domaine, donne les ordres.   --

column11: Gold . . . orders.  -    -  Some restaurants have a small gold bell to call someone to take customers´ orders.  -  In high society, people ring a small golden bell to call their servants and give their orders.
column12: Métal...ordres. La clochette de Harpagon apparaît ici en filigrane.  --

column11: Chop-seal . . . man.  -    -  I imagined some kind of initiation rite in old China, where every young man has to show his courage. They then receive a chopseal which is a mark of their courage.  -  Re: fuaburisu - The initiation rite in question is actually a reverse elbow chop to the brain, and you receive the chop seal if you have the power to withstand it. This initial imagery helps me with the altered chop seal and vertical placement.
column12: Sceau...rizière...force. Une grande partie de la surface cultivable du Japon est dévolue à la culture du riz mais les rizières ne furent pas créées en un jour : en 723 fut promulguée une loi accordant la possession d'une rizière pendant trois générations à qui défricherait un terrain. Cette loi n'eut peut-être pas l'effet escompté car, vingt ans plus tard, la durée de possession était portée à perpétuité. En pratique, le gouverneur local apposait probablement son sceau sur un document certifiant le titre de propriété de la rizière, et il n'était demandé à l'aspirant propriétaire que de rassembler ses forces, et cela demandait un certain courage, ou une certaine vigueur. Nous évitons ici d'employer le composant homme, qui n'est pas employé dans les dictionnaires pour le classement des kanjis. Ce kanji est classé sous la clé 力.  --

column11: Chop-seal . . . utilize . . . road. By combining the first two primitives into a single image, you will be able to use that image in a few instances later, one of which comes immediately.  -    -  I bounce down the road on my pogo stick, easily getting through the dense traffic. (Note: New primitive: chop-seal + utilize = pogo stick. Because a chop-seal is long and thin with a rubbery bit at the end. If it were big enough, you could utilize it as a pogo stick). [Edit: pogo stick also appears in 1409, 1690, 2530].  -  Building on gorgon´s story I now change mine to a much more silly and rememberable one. The Chinese police is using a helicopter to check and regulate the traffic. Hanging from the helicopter is a huge chopseal that they utilize to mark some of the cars that are causing trouble on the road.
column12: Route...usure.  --

column11: Wooden leg . . . chop-seal . . . utilize.  -    -  The winner of the long jump competition was disqualified when they found he used a pogo stick tied to his leg to jump further.  -  The high jumper has his wooden leg fitted with a pogo stick, and can now jump even higher. (See my note at traffic (#1408) for pogo stick). EDIT (2 years later): Keyword "jump" leads to confusion later on (see cjon256´s post), "Dancing" would be better (but be sure to keep it distinct from dance (#1774)). New Story: I was no good at dancing due to my wooden leg... until I had it fitted with a pogo stick!
column12: Jambe de bois...usure.   --
